title: Definitions
context: [ยง613-1] Definitions. As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;Alternative dispute resolution&rdquo; or &ldquo;ADR&rdquo; means methods, procedures, or techniques that are used to resolve differences voluntarily and that do not require a traditional and formal adjudicatory trial or contested hearing. These methods include, but are not limited to, mediation, contractual arbitration, fact- finding, consensus-building, and neutral-expert evaluation. &ldquo;Board&rdquo; means the board of advisors of the center for alternative dispute resolution. &ldquo;Center&rdquo; means the center for alternative dispute resolution. &ldquo;Government agencies&rdquo; means the offices, departments, branches, and other subdivisions of state and county governments. [L 1989, c 346, pt of ยง2; am L 1991, c 131, ยง1]
